page.title: 19NON-CONFORMIST CHURCHES
page.content: There are 2 non-conformist churches in the village.The Baptist Church, founded in 1663 and rebuilt in 1774 is a listed building.The Church meets only once a month,as, of the 8 members only 2 live in the village.The others have moved to a nearby town but still attend the services regularly.A lay preacher oversees the running of the church affairs.Land and the Manse owned by the church are rented out. The Methodist Church,built in 1887 has a weekly service,attended by 8-12 mainly village residents.It runs the only Sunday School in the village which has 17 regular scholars.The church is cared for by a circuit minister,and is one of a group of 6, all of which contribute to a central fund.Occasionally these churches get together to share a service.At other times local preachers officiate.
